# Multi-Project Development Workspace

<!-- Generated by Copilot -->

A collection of development projects and learning exercises covering various programming languages, frameworks, and design patterns. This workspace serves as a comprehensive study guide and reference implementation for modern software development practices.

### [See Documentation](https://weerachai06.github.io/programming-bible/)

```
workspace/
```

## üéØ Current Projects

### ‚úÖ React Design Patterns
**Location**: `nextjs/`
**Tech Stack**: Next.js 15, React 19, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS v4

A comprehensive learning project demonstrating various React design patterns through interactive examples.

**Features**:
- Observable Pattern implementation
- Performance optimization techniques
- Visual debugging tools
- Responsive design patterns

**Quick Start**:
```bash
cd nextjs
pnpm install
pnpm dev
```

**Demo**: [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000)

### üöß Future Projects

#### Go Language Projects (Planned)
- **Web APIs**: RESTful services with Gin/Echo
- **Microservices**: gRPC and Docker containerization
- **CLI Tools**: Command-line utilities and tools
- **Concurrency Patterns**: Goroutines and channels

#### Python Projects (Planned)
- **Data Analysis**: NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib
- **Web Scraping**: BeautifulSoup, Scrapy
- **Machine Learning**: Scikit-learn, TensorFlow
- **FastAPI**: Modern API development

#### Rust Projects (Planned)
- **System Programming**: Low-level utilities
- **WebAssembly**: Browser-compatible modules
- **CLI Applications**: Performance-focused tools
- **Web Services**: Actix-web, Warp frameworks

## üõ†Ô∏è Prerequisites

### General Requirements
- **Git**: Version control system
- **Docker**: Containerization (optional)
- **VS Code**: Recommended editor with workspace support

### Language-Specific Requirements

#### For React Projects
- **Node.js**: v20 or higher
- **pnpm**: v10.8.1+ (package manager)

#### For Go Projects (Future)
- **Go**: v1.21+ 
- **Go Modules**: Dependency management

#### For Python Projects (Future)
- **Python**: v3.9+
- **pip/poetry**: Package management
- **Virtual Environment**: Isolation

#### For Rust Projects (Future)
- **Rust**: Latest stable version
- **Cargo**: Package manager and build tool

## üöÄ Getting Started

### Clone the Workspace
```bash
git clone <repository-url>
cd multi-project-workspace
```

### Navigate to Specific Projects
```bash
# React project
cd nextjs
pnpm install && pnpm dev

# Future Go project
cd golang-projects/web-api
go mod tidy && go run main.go

# Future Python project
cd python-projects/data-analysis
pip install -r requirements.txt && python main.py

# Future Rust project
cd rust-projects/cli-tool
cargo build && cargo run
```

## üìú Available Commands

### Workspace Level
```bash
# Initialize all projects
make init-all

# Run tests across all projects
make test-all

# Build all projects
make build-all

# Clean all build artifacts
make clean-all
```

### Project-Specific Commands
Each project has its own README with specific commands and setup instructions.

## üé® Development Principles

### Code Quality
- **Linting**: Language-specific linters (ESLint, golint, flake8, clippy)
- **Formatting**: Automated code formatting
- **Testing**: Unit and integration tests
- **Documentation**: Comprehensive inline documentation

### Architecture Patterns
- **Clean Architecture**: Separation of concerns
- **Design Patterns**: Gang of Four and modern patterns
- **SOLID Principles**: Object-oriented design
- **Functional Programming**: Where applicable

### Performance
- **Optimization**: Profile-guided optimization
- **Monitoring**: Performance metrics and monitoring
- **Caching**: Appropriate caching strategies
- **Scalability**: Horizontal and vertical scaling considerations

## üöÄ Deployment

### CI/CD Pipeline
The workspace includes GitHub Actions for:
- **Automated Testing**: Run tests on all projects
- **Build Verification**: Ensure all projects build successfully
- **Security Scanning**: Code security analysis
- **Deployment**: Environment-specific deployments

### Container Support
- **Docker**: Containerized applications
- **Docker Compose**: Multi-service orchestration
- **Kubernetes**: Production deployment manifests

## ü§ù Contributing

### Adding New Projects

1. **Create project directory**
   ```bash
   mkdir <language>-projects/<project-name>
   cd <language>-projects/<project-name>
   ```

2. **Initialize project**
   - Follow language-specific initialization
   - Add appropriate README.md
   - Include necessary configuration files

3. **Update workspace README**
   - Add project to the structure diagram
   - Include quick start instructions
   - Update available commands

4. **Add CI/CD configuration**
   - Extend GitHub Actions workflows
   - Include project-specific build/test steps

### Code Standards
- Follow language-specific conventions
- Include comprehensive tests
- Write clear documentation
- Use consistent naming patterns

## üìö Learning Resources

### General Development
- [Clean Code](https://www.amazon.com/Clean-Code-Handbook-Software-Craftsmanship/dp/0132350884)
- [Design Patterns](https://refactoring.guru/design-patterns)
- [System Design](https://github.com/donnemartin/system-design-primer)

### Language-Specific Resources
- **React/TypeScript**: [React Docs](https://react.dev/), [TypeScript Handbook](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/)
- **Go**: [Go Tour](https://tour.golang.org/), [Effective Go](https://golang.org/doc/effective_go.html)
- **Python**: [Python Docs](https://docs.python.org/), [Real Python](https://realpython.com/)
- **Rust**: [Rust Book](https://doc.rust-lang.org/book/), [Rust by Example](https://doc.rust-lang.org/rust-by-example/)
